basics.name: Daniel Viaño Castro
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Experienced C++ Software Engineer specializing in aerospace, air traffic management, and embedded systems. Skilled in developing robust, high-performance solutions for mission-critical applications, with a strong background in system integration and modern software methodologies. Proven track record in defense, surveying, and advanced imaging systems.

work.name: Darwin Recruitment
work.summary: Embedded Software Engineer for Hexagon Productization Center, developing hybrid airborne sensor systems for advanced imaging and data acquisition.
highlights: Developed the MultiMapper hybrid sensor system, integrating 11 RGB and 2 NIR cameras with LiDAR technology to enable simultaneous collection of multi-spectral imagery and 3D point clouds for large-area mapping applications, achieving superior data consistency through advanced sensor synchronization

Developed camera firmware, including image acquisition and image processing algorithms for 11 RGB and 2 NIR cameras, ensuring precise time synchronization to deliver reliable raw and processed TIFF images for multi-spectral mapping applications, using C++

Developed LiDAR firmware, including its digital signal processing algorithm, motor synchronization and positioning, ensuring precise time synchronization to generate accurate 3D point clouds for terrain modeling and hydrographic mapping, using C++

Conducted comprehensive testing and validation of the 20kg MultiMapper system, ensuring reliable performance in airborne environments through rigorous unit testing with gtest and integration testing with pytest on Embedded Linux platforms

Optimized system architecture for Zynq UltraScale+, collaborating closely with FPGA team to deliver production-ready firmware for mission-critical surveying operations with enhanced efficiency and reduced power consumption, using Petalinux SDK

work.name: Akkodis
work.summary: Developed handheld image acquisition devices for SAFRAN Vectronix, focusing on sensor integration, user interface, testing, and system validation.
highlights: Developed C++ firmware for Nightwolf multi-spectral targeting system, enabling exceptional situational awareness for special forces through SWIR capabilities that penetrate smoke and haze while achieving ±1.5m accuracy over 12km range, using Qt for user interface and Embedded Linux platforms

Integrated multi-spectral sensors including daylight, thermal, low light, color CMOS, and SWIR channels for handheld image acquisition devices, ensuring reliable performance in extreme conditions through comprehensive testing with gtest and Robot Framework
Implemented streaming features for bidirectional real-time video sharing and processing using GStreamer
Developed augmented reality widgets to enhance user awareness, delivering advanced visualization capabilities using Qt Widgets
Validated system functionality across different Embedded Linux platforms, delivering production-ready software for mission-critical operations, using Petalinux SDK and Yocto

work.name: Ad Maiorem Consulting
work.summary: Built and maintained surveillance software for Air Traffic Control systems for INDRA, supporting SACTA and iTEC alliance members in mission-critical environments.
highlights: Maintained and modernized legacy surveillance software written in Ada, achieving zero production crashes while implementing new features through systematic code refactoring and optimization

Implemented ADS-B as a new data source for Air Traffic Control systems, providing more accurate and timely position data with second-by-second updates while expanding aircraft tracking coverage in non-radar airspace. This reduced ground infrastructure costs by at least 90% compared to traditional radar systems, and was developed in C++ while integrating with existing Ada codebase.

Developed C++ software components for new Air Traffic Control systems, achieving 99.9% uptime for safety-critical operations supporting SACTA and iTEC alliance members through rigorous testing and system integration

Ensured software reliability for mission-critical environments, achieving zero production incidents over 24-month deployment period across multiple European air traffic control systems through comprehensive testing protocols and proactive system monitoring

work.name: Pildo Labs
work.summary: Designed and developed coordination systems for manned and unmanned aircraft, including air navigation and ADS-B/GNSS acquisition solutions for aerospace initiatives.
highlights: Designed coordination systems for aerial surveillance and firefighting operations, enabling 24/7 monitoring capabilities that extended firefighting operations beyond sunset through simultaneous management of manned and unmanned aircraft

Developed airborne navigation and communication software for 25kg UAV and manned helicopters, ensuring compliance with DO-178 and ED-12 aviation certification standards for autonomous flight operations using C++

Developed ground control station user interface, complying with DO-278 and ED-109 standards to provide operators with full view of firefighting operations instead of limited visual line-of-sight from helicopters, using C++ and Qt Framework
Integrated ADS-B, RADAR, and GNSS acquisition solutions, achieving centimeter-level positioning accuracy for precision aerial operations combining multiple data sources

work.name: EUROCONTROL
work.summary: Conducted Pan-European studies on continuous climb/descent operations, managed ADS-B data, and validated tools and configurations for air traffic research.
highlights: Contributed to the 2018 ECAC-wide study on continuous climb/descent operations that identified €150M in potential annual fuel savings across European airspace by fixing and validating the tools required written in Java

Analyzed the entire European air traffic ADS-B data over a full year, processing millions of flights to provide actionable insights for Pan-European air traffic optimization studies through advanced filtering and data analysis techniques
